result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J Korbisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Furnishing a Firearm to an Unauthorized Person [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health/ Assessment/ Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and only at the discretion/approval of your by Agent.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.
Zero days credit.
Not eligible for substance abuse or challenge.

timeConds.notes: 2nd half may be served on Electronic Monitor, if quailifies according to local jail rule.  Go today get start time. Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

BY THE COURT: Court grants the continuance.

P. Grabow makes additiona

from DOC unable to contact Defendant - dated May 27, 2016
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul J Korbisch in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:06 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count's 2 & 3 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
PSI Ordered 
PSI to be provided to the parties by no later than one week prior to sentencing
Bond and conditions of bond ordered continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul J Korbisch in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:19 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea hearing.

There is a plea agreement at this time.

Defendant will plead to Count 1.
Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.

State recommends an imposed 5 year prison sentence. 2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision. State requests a PSI.

Atty Renc concurs, but addresses party to the crime modifier in Count 1.
Atty Molepske replies.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: NO CONTEST - (STRIKEN)

Court takes a moment to review the file.
Court will recuse the Court. Court knows the family.

Court does not think Court should stay on the case.

A new judge will be assigned.  

Scheduling can be done once a new judge is assigned.

BY THE COURT:
Court will recuse itself.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.
The plea that was entered is striken from the record and any new plea will have to be entered.
